root.name: create
tip:
Create a resource from a file or from stdin
JSON and YAML formats are accepted.
E: create -f ./pod.json                    --- Create a pod using the data in pod.json
   create -f registry.yaml --edit -o json  --- Edit the data in registry.yaml in JSON then create the resource using the edited data

root.name: expose
root.tip: Take a replication controller, service, deployment or pod and expose it as a new Kubernetes service

root.name: run
root.tip: Run a particular image on the cluster

root.name: set
root.tip: Set specific features on objects

root.name: explain
root.tip: Get documentation for a resource

root.name: get
root.tip: Display one or many resources

root.name: edit
root.tip: Edit a resource on the server

root.name: delete
root.tip: Delete resources by file names, stdin, resources and names, or by resources and label selector

root.name: rollout
root.tip: Manage the rollout of a resource

root.name: scale
root.tip: Set a new size for a deployment, replica set, or replication controller

root.name: autoscale
root.tip: Auto-scale a deployment, replica set, stateful set, or replication controller

root.name: certificate
root.tip: Modify certificate resources

root.name: cluster-info
root.tip: Display cluster information

root.name: top
root.tip: Display resource (CPU/memory) usage

root.name: cordon
tip: E: cordon foo   --- Mark node "foo" as unschedulable

root.name: uncordon
tip: E: uncordon foo   --- Mark node "foo" as schedulable

root.name: drain
root.tip: Drain node in preparation for maintenance

root.name: taint
root.tip: Update the taints on one or more nodes

root.name: describe
root.tip: Show details of a specific resource or group of resources

root.name: logs
root.tip: Print the logs for a container in a pod

root.name: attach
root.tip: Attach to a running container

root.name: exec
root.tip: Execute a command in a container

root.name: port-forward
root.tip: Forward one or more local ports to a pod

root.name: proxy
root.tip: Run a proxy to the Kubernetes API server

root.name: cp
root.tip: Copy files and directories to and from containers

root.name: auth
root.tip: Inspect authorization

root.name: debug
root.tip: Create debugging sessions for troubleshooting workloads and nodes

root.name: events
root.tip: List events

root.name: diff
root.tip: Diff the live version against a would-be applied version

root.name: apply
root.tip: Apply a configuration to a resource by file name or stdin

root.name: patch
root.tip: Update fields of a resource

root.name: replace
root.tip: Replace a resource by file name or stdin

root.name: wait
root.tip: Experimental: Wait for a specific condition on one or many resources

root.name: kustomize
root.tip: Build a kustomization target from a directory or URL

root.name: label
root.tip: Update the labels on a resource

root.name: annotate
root.tip: Update the annotations on a resource

root.name: completion
root.tip: Output shell completion code for the specified shell (bash, zsh, fish, or powershell)

root.name: api-resources
root.tip: Print the supported API resources on the server

root.name: api-versions
root.tip: Print the supported API versions on the server, in the form of "group/version"

root.name: config
root.tip: Modify kubeconfig files

root.name: plugin
root.tip: Provides utilities for interacting with plugins

root.name: version
root.tip: Print the client and server version information

root.name: options
root.tip: List some options can be passed to any command

description: Kubernetes, also known as K8s, is an open source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.
